<h1 align="center">
  parramore.dev
</h1>

Gastsby site built using a [starter blog boilerplate](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog). This starter shipped with the main Gatsby configuration files and setup.

### ðŸš€ Quick start

1.  **Clone the repo**

    ```shell
    git clone https://github.com/JParramore/parramoredotdev
    cd parramoredotdev
    ```

2.  **Install the project dependencies**

    ```shell
    yarn install
    ```
    or
    ```shell
    npm install
    ```

3.  **Run the project**

    ```shell
    gatsby develop
    ```

    The site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._

## ðŸŽ“ More about Gatsby

Full documentation for Gatsby lives [on the website](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/). Here are some places to start:

- [In-depth tutorial for creating a site with Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/).

- [Documentation](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/).
